title: Covid LIVE: Time for armed forces to help civil administration, says CDS
description: Coronavirus live updates: India cases stand at 17,636,307. Six most affected states are Maharashtra, Kerala, Karnataka, Uttar Pradesh, Tamil Nadu and Delhi. Stay tuned for corona-related news

title: Assam imposes night curfew till May 1 following a spike in Covid-19 cases
description: A spike in Covid-19 positive cases in Assam has prompted the state government to impose night curfew from 8 pm to 5 am from Tuesday till May 1. The government also warned of strict action against violators. The order issued by Assam Chief Secretary Jishnu Baruah prohibiting individual movement during the period will come into effect immediately. The order, however, exempted those involved in emergency government services from the purview of the curfew.

title: Covid Latest Updates: Night curfew imposed in Assam from 8 pm to 5 am, order comes into immediate effect and will remain in place till 1st May - The Economic Times

title: India’s COVID crisis: Bhutan to supply oxygen to Assam, Bhutanese citizen show solidarity
description: Even as the COVID crisis creates havoc in India, Bhutan will be supplying 40 metric tonnes of liquid Oxygen to Assam. The Oxygen will be exported using cryogenic tankers. The Oxygen will come from a new plant from Motanga Industrial Estate in Eastern Bhutan's Samdrup Jongkhar district.

title: Assam’s first female IAS officer succumbs to COVID - The Shillong Times
description: SHILLONG, April 26: Former Additional Chief Secretary of Assam, Parul Devi Das, died in Guwahati today after falling prey to the dreaded COVID-19 disease. An Assam-Meghalaya cadre officer, she was the first woman IAS officer from Assam. She briefly served Meghalaya in the early 1980s. She was born and bred in Shillong. Her father, late […]

title: Assam reports 3,137 new Covid-19 cases, 15 deaths
description: A retired IAS officer and a young journalist were among 15 deaths Assam reported due to Covid-19 on Monday as the total number of active positive cases rose to 17,764. Parul Devi Das, who was the first woman IAS officer from Assam passed away at a private hospital on Monday afternoon after battling with Covid. Das retired as an additional chief secretary in 2010.
